item.title: Archaeologists find evidence that horseback riding began at least 5,000 years ago
item.description: Researchers analyzed more than 200 Bronze Age skeletal remains in museum collections in Bulgaria, Poland, Romania, Hungary and the Czech Republic to look for signs of what co-author and University of Helsinki anthropologist Martin Trautmann calls "horse rider syndrome."

item.title: Remembering Mandy Jenkins, Kent State grad and national digital news pioneer
